title.narrative: 3.3 NUTRITION BEHAVIOUR

description.narrative: Output 3.3: Parents and caregivers have improved knowledge and skills to adopt essential nutrition practices, which contributes to Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 3: Children, adolescent mothers and women, particularly in vulnerable and deprived areas, have increased access to quality services and information, and adopt appropriate nutritional practices to prevent and treat malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: Parents and caregivers have improved knowledge and skills to adopt essential nutrition practices

description.narrative: Given the exceptionally low rates of dietary diversity in Nigeria, a proof of concept on improving complementary feeding through strategic behavior change is being implemented in Kano State. Besides counseling parents and caregivers, the project innovatively leverages the Emirate (Religious) Council to accelerate uptake of optimal practice. ;Additionally, the region-wide Stronger with Breastmilk Only (SWBO) Initiative, dubbed ‘No water campaign’ originally launched in 2019 was also sustained, with peak emphasis during the annually celebrated World Breastfeeding Week. Despite these initiatives, inadequate funding, has limited the scale and scope of efforts to address social norms that impact nutrition behaviors. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:23/12/2021
